name: Leather Armor
description: A jacket, fittings around the arms, knee pads, and boots all fall under leather armor.

name: Metal Armor
description: Combination of various pieces that have been welded or fitted around the body.

name: Ballistic Weave
description: Pre-war synthetic fiber whose reproduction has been lost.

name: Bag (Backpack)
description: A leather, burlap, or cloth bag with straps.

props.specialText: If you wear more than one bag that has items stored in it, you are Encumbered unless STR or END >= 8.

name: Milsurp Review
description: Reviewing and discussing military firearms.

name: Addictol
description: An experimental inhaled medicine that removes physical and psychological effects of addiction.

props.effect: Cure all addictions
props.sideEffect: Gain 3 levels of Dehydration, Hunger, and Exhaustion

props.effect: Resistant to Poison damage (6 hours)

name: Doctor's Bag
description: A large carry bag full of medical supplies used to fix severe injuries.

actions.name: Stitch Wounds
actions.effect: Heal HP (2 * Healing Rate + Medicine Skill)

actions.name: Set Bone
actions.effect: Remove Broken Arm or Broken Leg condition

props.description: Increases strength, reflexes, and endurance.
Buffout mixed with Jet.
Tranquilizer that boosts survival senses.

name: Cache Clearer
description: Removes unnecessary data allowing for faster processing speed.

name: Predictive Chatbot
description: Analyzes conversations in real time to provide optimal responses.

ranks.effect: -5 explosive damage
-10 explosive damage
-15 explosive damage
-5 laser and plasma damage
-5 laser and plasma damage
-10 laser and plasma damage
If starting turn with half HP, move 10 ft. for 1 AP
If starting turn with half HP, DT increases by 5

name: Bag (Camping)
description: Large, heavy duty backpack with nylon strings and waist belt.

props.specialText: If you wear more than one bag that has items stored in it, you are Encumbered unless STR or END >= 8.

name: Bag (Range)
description: Single bag with one sling to allow weapons to be stored.

props.specialText: Store up to 3 Two-Handed/Unwieldy weapons; their Load is halved.

name: Bandolier
description: Pocketed strap that fits across the body.

props.specialText: Not considered a bag. Can be worn with a backpack without penalty.

name: Max Charge
description: Overcharged cells that deal massive damage but degrade weapons.

props.specialEffect: After every 3rd attack, the weapon gains a level of Decay.

name: Bulk
description: Cheap, mass-produced energy ammunition.

name: Armor Piercing
description: Tungsten core rounds designed to punch through plating.

props.specialEffect: If target not in Power Armor, ignores up to 8 DT and target armor gains Decay. If target in Power Armor, deals +8 damage to Defense Points.

name: Hollow Point
description: Rounds designed to expand on impact, causing massive tissue damage.

props.specialEffect: Extra damage equal to Critical Hit damage. However, if damage is reduced by DT, the damage gains no bonus and is halved.

name: Low Yield
description: Smaller explosive payload for safer handling.

name: Cloth Armor
description: Cloth armor doesn't provide much protection. However it lends its simplicity to being light and having the most amount of upgrade slots. Most vault suits are considered cloth armor.

name: Leather Armor
description: A jacket, fittings around the arms, knee pads, and boots all fall under leather armor. Leather isn't very tough but can fit easily around one's body.

name: Metal Armor
description: In the wasteland, you take what you can get. Metal armor is a combination of various pieces that have been welded or fitted around the body. Granting toughness but allowing less coverage.

name: Multilayered Armor
description: A combination of vestments. Layers of leather, cloth, tarp, metal, anything lying around to act as armor is considered multilayered. This armor provides maximum coverage but sacrifices toughness.

name: Ballistic Weave
description: Bulletproof vests, kevlar, or military grade jackets. Ballistic weave is a pre-war synthetic fiber whose reproduction has been lost with the war. Extremely rare but provides the best of all armor aspects; coverage, toughness, and weight.

name: Steel Armor
description: Fitted plates of metal that cover the body like a knight provide a modern solution in the apocalypse for dealing with threats. Steel maximizes coverage and toughness, so long as you have the strength.

ranks.effect: You gain advantage on Sneak skill checks relying on sight.
You gain advantage on Sneak skill checks relying on sound.
While in Dim Light, you are functionally invisible.
-5 Load. -1 Strength req. -1 DT.
-10 Load (min 3).
If you spend at least 4 AP to move, you can move an extra 10 ft.
When you take damage from an Area of Effect attack, your DT is doubled.
Your max SP increases by a number equal to your level.
You have advantage on Combat Sequence rolls. If you already have advantage, you gain +5.
-2 Radiation DC.
-2 Radiation DC.
-2 Radiation DC.
When you take damage from a critical hit, your DT is increased by 3.
When you take damage from a critical hit, your DT is increased by an additional 5.
If you would gain a Severe Injury, you instead gain a random limb condition.
You ignore the first 2 levels of Decay for the armor.
You ignore an additional 2 levels of Decay for the armor.
Your armor no longer gains a level of Decay when critically hit.
+10 Carry Weight.
+15 Carry Weight.
+25 Carry Weight.
+1 DT.
+1 DT.
+1 DT.
+1 AC.
+1 AC.
+1 AC.
When you take damage from Fire damage, your DT is doubled.
You gain resistance to Fire damage.
Immune to the Burning condition.
You are insulated against the cold. -1 max AP (to a minimum of 6).
Your max AP is no longer reduced. Rank 2 costs 800c.
You gain additional AP at the start of your turns equal to each level of Decay the armor has.

Spend 3 AP to activate or deactivate. When activated, each creature within 10 ft. of you takes 1d6 electricity damage at the start of their turns. For each round active, remove 20 AP from Operation AP.
Electricity damage increases by 1d6. For each round active, remove an additional 20 AP from Operation AP.
Electricity damage increases by 2d6. For each round active, remove an additional 40 AP from Operation AP.
When you take damage from a Melee or Unarmed attack, the attacker takes a quarter of the damage they dealt.
The attacker now takes half of the damage they dealt.
When you take damage from a Melee or Unarmed attack, the attacker is knocked back 15 ft..
When you consume Irradiated food or water when in Power Armor, you gain no Rads.
Spending more than 18 AP on one turn causes Overheating instead of 15.
Spending more than 20 AP on one turn causes Overheating instead of 15.
Overheating removes only 50 AP from Operation AP instead of 100.
You can spend 1 AP to fly 5 ft. upwards. For every 5 feet you fly, you spend 10 Operation AP.
+5 Passive Sense.
+5 Passive Sense.
+10 Passive Sense.
Targeted Attacks now cost 1 less AP.
Targeted Attacks now cost 1 less AP.
Spend 6 AP to learn the HP, SP, AC, or DT of a creature you can see.
Spend 3 AP to mark a creature you can see. You can only mark one creature at a time. When you deal damage to a marked creature, your number of damage dice is increased by 1.
You can now mark two creatures at a time.
Whenever you deal damage to a marked creature, your damage dice increases by 1 again.
Spend 1 AP to turn on/off your headlamp. The headlamp shines Bright Light in a 40 ft. cone and Dim Light for an additional 40 ft..
The Bright and Dim light both shine an additional 10 ft..
The Bright and Dim light both shine an additional 10 ft.. If you turn this light on in Darkness, each creature within 5 ft. of you gains the Blinded condition for 1 round.
If you damage a creatureâ€™s HP with an Unarmed Strike, they gain one level of Bleeding.
Spend 6 AP to make a special Unarmed Strike that deals 2d8 bludgeoning damage.
The damage increases by 1d8 (3d8 total)
The damage increases by 1d8 (4d8 total) and the target is knocked back 15 ft..
+15 Carry Load.
+15 Carry Load.
+20 Carry Load.
While Overheated: +2 maximum AP. Advantage on attack rolls. Move 15 ft. for 1 AP. Unarmed Strikes and Weapon attacks deal an additional 3d6 fire damage.
Spend 3 AP to Overheat the Fusion Core.
+2 maximum AP.

If you fall at least 15 ft., you can choose to use this upgrade. Each creature within 20 ft. of you takes 3d6 fire damage and 3d6 explosive damage. Each time you do this, remove 80 AP from Operation AP.
The fire and explosive damage increases by 1d6.
The radius increases by 10 ft..

The armor is modified and fitted to allow a Super Mutant to wear it. However, Humans and Ghouls can no longer use the armor. Once added, the upgrade can only be removed by being purchased or crafted again.

props.range: 40 ft. line, 10 ft. wide OR a 20ft. cone

special: Damage x = Carry Load of item shot (max 15)
Can fire as long as it is in Sunlight
Requires Charge action (6 AP) before it can fire, gains a level of Decay every time it is fired

props.description: The weapon is turned into a Turret that must be connected to a terminal via wiring. Before activation, you can designate any creatures who will not be targeted. You can spend 6 AP to activate or deactivate the turret from the terminal. When you roll combat sequence, the turret gets its own sequence with a bonus equal to your INT modifier. The turret has 10 AP and will attack the closest creature in its short range. The turret is a Robot with 25 HP, 10 AC. If a turret reaches 0 HP, it ceases function and the weapon gains 1 level of Decay.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any weapon

props.description: The weapon is turned into a Turret that must be connected to a terminal via wiring. You can spend 6 AP to activate or deactivate the turret from the terminal. When you spend AP to attack with the turret, the AP cost is reduced by 2 to a minimum of 3 AP. If your Intelligence score is less than the Strength requirement of the weapon, your attacks have disadvantage. The turret is a Robot with 25 HP, 10 AC. If a turret reaches 0 HP, it ceases function and the weapon gains 1 level of Decay.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any weapon

props.description: Attach a Knife or Combat Knife to your weapon. You can attack with the knife without spending AP to switch weapons.

props.description: The weapon gains the Breakable property. Load is halved. -1 Strength requirement.

props.description: +10 long range modifier. -2 short range modifier. +4 Load.

props.description: Before you make an attack, you can spend 6 AP to mark a creature within the weapon's short range. Attack rolls against that creature have advantage until you target another creature, the creature leaves the long range of your weapon, or combat ends.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any energy weapon except for Gauss Rifle, Gauss Pistol, or Gatling Laser.

props.description: Short range modifier is doubled. Long range modifier is quadrupled. Attacks made within 50 ft. have disadvantage. +2 Load.

props.description: The weapon gains the Semi-Automatic property.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any weapon without Manual/Quick Reload, Automatic, Area of Effect, or Energy Weapon.

props.description: Any attacks while Hidden do not cause you to enter Danger. +2 Load. Damage dice rank decreases once (min d4). If the dice rank cannot decrease any further, the weapon instead gains the Weak property.

props.description: You can reload with 4 AP.

props.description: +1 to the attack roll. +4 Load.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any SMG, rifle, shotgun, energy weapon, or revolver w/ long barrel.

props.description: The weapon gains Sturdy and Defensive. +2 Load.
props.compatibleWeapons: Any weapon. Cannot have Strengthened or Light Build mods.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .32 rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank decreases once (min d4).
props.compatibleWeapons: Combat Rifle, Bolt-Action Pipe Pistol, Pipe Revolver, Hunting Rifle. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use .32.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use 5.56mm rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank changes to d10.
props.compatibleWeapons: Varmint Rifle, Handmade Assault Rifle, Chinese Assault Rifle. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use 5.56mm.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .45 rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank increases once (max d12) and its critical hit chance decreases by 1.
props.compatibleWeapons: Pipe Pistol, Pipe Rifle, Lever Action Rifle. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use .45.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .308 rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank changes to d10.
props.compatibleWeapons: Hunting Rifle, Combat Rifle, Bolt-Action Pipe Pistol, Pipe Revolver, Hand Cannon. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use .308.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .45-70 Govâ€™t rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank changes to d10.
props.compatibleWeapons: Lever Action Rifle. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use .45-70 Govâ€™t.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .50 rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank changes to d12.
props.compatibleWeapons: Service Rifle. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use 12.7mm.

props.description: The weapon is rechambered to use .50 rounds for its ammo. Its damage dice rank changes to d12 and the weapon gains the Destructive property.
props.compatibleWeapons: Hunting Rifle, Bolt-Action Pipe Pistol, Hand Cannon. Cannot have another rechamber mod or already use .50.

props.effect: This syringe has no additional effects.
The target must make a Disease check.
The target gains the effects of the Stimpak you load the syringe with.
The target gains the effect of the chem you load the syringe with.

The target must make a DC 10 Endurance check. If they fail, the larva infests their body. They will take 1d8 poison damage at the start of each of their turns, and after 5 turns, they will take 2d10 damage as a Bloatfly spawns on their spot.
The target gains the Poisoned condition for 3 turns and takes 1d6 poison damage at the start of each of those 3 turns.
The target's DT is reduced by 3 for 1 minute.
The target becomes Frightened for 3 rounds.
The target spends all its AP on its next turn to attack the nearest creature.
The target gains 1 level of Bleeding.
The target gains the Slowed condition for 2 rounds.
The target gains the Deafened condition for 3 rounds.
The target gains the Blinded condition for 3 rounds.
The target can no longer see any creatures beyond 30 ft. of them for 1 minute.
If the target's Endurance is 4 or lower, they fall Unconscious for 1 hour. Otherwise, the target gains the Dazed condition for 3 turns and falls Unconscious at the end of their 3rd turn.

props.specialEffect: If the attack damages a target's HP, they must make a Disease check. Damage is 1d4 and you do not add the Agility modifier.

If the attack damages a target's HP and the target is not wearing Power Armor, it ignores up to 8 DT and the target's armor gains a level of Decay. If target is in Power Armor, deals +8 damage to Defense Points.
Damage is 1d4+1 and you do not add the Agility modifier. Target takes 1 level of Fatigue. Brings target to 0 HP as Unconscious (1 HP) unless Targeted Attack to Head/Eyes.

The weapon loses its Spread property. After every 2nd attack, the weapon gains a level of Decay.

The weapon's damage is halved but it gains the Incendiary property.

If the attack brings a target's HP to 0, the attack also targets the next creature behind them in a line.
If the attack damages a target's HP, it deals extra damage equal to the Critical Hit damage. However, if the damage is subtracted by the target's DT, the damage gains no bonus and is halved.

The weapon gains the Breakable property.
The weapon gains the Incendiary property.

The weapon gains the Incendiary property, however its explosive damage is reduced to 1d8.
The weapon gains the Spread property, however its short & long range modifiers are decreased by 2.
When you deal damage to a target's HP, they gain a level of Bleeding.
Targets hit by the weapon gain the Slowed condition until the end of their next turn.
When hit, any creature or object within 5 ft. of the target takes 3d6 explosive damage. The target falls prone if STR < 10. The projectile is destroyed.
Everything within 5 ft. takes 2d6 explosive damage. Creatures within 10 ft. gain Blinded condition for 2 turns. The projectile is destroyed.
Damage to HP causes Burning condition. Missed shots may start fires. Flammable objects burst into flames. The projectile is destroyed.
Deals an additional 1d8 plasma damage.
Damage to HP causes Poisoned condition for 3 turns.
Deals an additional 1d8 electricity damage. Targets in Power Armor lose 50 Operational AP. The projectile is destroyed.
Deals 2d6 sonic damage and knocks target back 5 ft on impact. The projectile is destroyed.

Target is Restrained. Escape: 6 AP and DC 12 Agility check. Success: Escaped. Failure: Remain ensnared.

name: Ball Bearings
description: You can spend 3 AP to scatter these small metal spheres across a flat surface in a 5 ft. radius.

props.effect: Any creature walking/running through area falls Prone and takes 1d4 impact damage unless they have Passive Sense > 15 or noticed them. Moving through requires 2 AP per 5 ft.
props.recovery: Removed on use. Can be gathered with 10 minutes of work.

name: Caltrops
description: You can spend 3 AP to scatter these small sharp objects across a flat surface in a 5 ft. radius.

props.effect: Any creature walking/running through area takes 10 piercing damage (ignores DT) unless they have Passive Sense > 15 or noticed them. Moving through requires 2 AP per 5 ft.
props.recovery: Removed on use. Can be gathered with 10 minutes of work.

name: Bear Trap
description: A heavy mechanical trap used to ensnare creatures.

props.escape: 6 AP and DC 15 Strength check. Disadvantage if END >= 6. Failure deals 1d4 piercing damage.

name: Binoculars
description: You can spend 3 AP to look through binoculars to magnify your sight.

props.effect: Advantage on Perception checks relying on sight for objects/creatures/locations at least 100 ft. away.

name: Water Skin
description: This leather pouch is fitted with a cap and nozzle and holds 64 oz. of liquid.

name: Rope
description: Used to tie items, make pulley systems, climb, or tie someone up.

props.effect: Advantage on Strength rolls to grapple or strangle if holding rope.

name: Chain
description: A length of metal chain.

props.effect: Advantage on Strength rolls to grapple or strangle if holding chain.

name: Lantern
description: A fuel-burning light source.

props.effect: Bright Light (20 ft.) and Dim Light (additional 20 ft.).
props.refuel: 6 AP using x1 Fuel Canister or x3 Oil materials.

name: Flare (Stick)
description: A handheld red flare.

props.effect: Red Bright Light (30 ft.) and Red Dim Light (additional 30 ft.) for 1 hour.
special: Can be used as Improvised Weapon (1d4 bludg / 1d4 crit).
If lit, deals additional 1d8 fire damage.

name: Flashlight
description: An electric handheld light.

props.effect: Bright Light (20 ft. cone) and Dim Light (additional 20 ft.) for 8 hours.
props.reload: 6 AP to load an Energy Cell.
special: Can be used as Improvised Weapon (1d4 bludg / 1d4 crit).

name: Fire Extinguisher
description: Spray CO2 foam to extinguish fires.

props.effect: Extinguish flames in a 5 ft. area within 10 ft.
special: Can be used as Improvised Weapon (2d10 bludgeoning, x2 crit). If it gains a level of Decay, it loses a use.

name: Gas Mask
description: Protective face gear.

props.effect: Radiation DC -3. Passive Sense -2. Protection against toxic airborne hazards.

name: Geiger Counter
description: Device for detecting radiation levels.

props.effect: Detects level of radiation and learns Radiation Severity Score when entering Irradiated Zone.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A metal hook that can be tied and attached to rope with 6 AP.

name: Handcuffs
description: A pair of metal handcuffs for restraining people.

props.condition: Attach to humanoid within 5 ft. Opposed STR check if unwilling (disadvantage if prone/restrained).
props.escape: DC 18 Strength check to break, or DC 14 Breach check to unlock.

name: Hazmat Suit, Powered
description: Advanced protection suit with air purification and impact absorption. Requires power to operate.

props.power: Requires 3 Energy Cells for 6 hours. Recharge cost 6 AP.
props.donDoff: 30 seconds (Automatic shrink fitting). Cannot wear armor with suit.
props.decayRule: Gains 1 level of Decay for every 5 HP damage taken.
props.repair: Crafting DC 15 (x2 lead, x1 leather, x1 circuitry).
props.note: Cannot be worn with other pieces of Armor or Power Armor.

name: Sleeping Bag
description: Nylon, cloth, or hide bag for sleeping in rough terrain.

props.effect: Any environment is considered Comfortable when resting.

name: Tent (One Person)
description: Small tent providing shelter from outside sources, weather, and terrain.

name: Tent (Two Person)
description: Larger tent providing shelter from outside sources, weather, and terrain.

name: Weapon Repair Kit
description: Plastic box filled with tools and mechanisms to repair weapons.

props.effect: After 1 minute, weapon loses 2 levels of Decay.

name: Codac R9000 Camera
description: Camera with large flash bulb taking high resolution photos.

props.effect: Flash illuminates 60 ft area with Bright Light. Creatures within 10 ft facing camera are Blinded for 1 round.

name: ProSnap Deluxe Camera
description: Compact rangefinder camera featuring multiple different lens options.

lenses.name: 105mm Lens
lenses.effect: Advantage on sight-based Perception checks for targets at least 50 ft. away.

lenses.name: 200mm Lens
lenses.effect: Advantage on sight-based Perception checks for targets at least 100 ft. away.

lenses.name: Night Vision Lens
lenses.effect: Night Vision for 50 ft. while looking through camera.

lenses.name: Targeting Lens
lenses.effect: Detects living targets within 50 ft. and highlights them for 1 round.

name: Camera Film
description: Celluloid material used to produce photographs.

name: Prosthetic Limb
description: A basic prosthetic to restore functionality to a missing body part.

props.effect: Halves negative STR/AGI modifiers (from -2 to -1). Regains basic functionality.
restrictions: Cannot be used with Adaptive Reflexes or Groovy perks
props.durability: Takes no damage from Targeted Attacks, but gains Decay (breaks at 10).
props.repair: 1 Decay = x1 steel, x1 rubber, x1 plastic.
props.special: If severed again, prosthetic breaks off instead. No Shock/Bleeding.

name: Robotic Limb
description: An advanced prosthetic that perfectly restores functionality.

props.effect: Removes negative STR/AGI modifiers. Regains full functionality. No movement or AP penalties.
restrictions: Cannot be used with Adaptive Reflexes or Groovy perks
props.durability: Takes no damage from Targeted Attacks, but gains Decay (breaks at 10).
props.repair: 1 Decay = x1 steel, x1 gear, x1 circuitry.
props.special: If severed again, robotic limb breaks off instead. No Shock/Bleeding.

name: Alien Epoxy
description: Blue goo that repairs material damage.

props.effect: Remove 2 levels of Decay from a tool, weapon, or armor.

name: Chinese Stealth Armor
description: Form-fitting black bodysuit with cloaking technology.

props.effect: Spend 3 AP to become Invisible for 1 minute (1 hour recharge).
props.notes: Cannot be modified. Cannot be worn with other Armor/Power Armor. If armor reaches 5 Decay, cloaking stops working.

name: Electronic Lockpick
description: Advanced device to auto-pick locks.

props.effect: Attach to lock. Opens after 6 seconds (1 round). Breaks after use.

name: Electronic Lockpick (Mk2)
description: Robust electronic lockpick.

props.effect: Identical to Electronic Lockpick but breaks after 3 uses.

name: Explosive Collar
description: Slaver control device.

props.disarm: Key or Explosives Check DC 16. Failure by 5+ triggers detonation.

name: Mutation Serum
description: Modifies genetic material.

props.effect: Gain 1 Mutation of your choice.

name: Night Vision Goggles
description: Goggles granting night vision.

props.effect: Gain 100 ft. Night Vision. Lasts 6 hours per Energy Cell.
props.drawback: Exposure to Bright Light causes Blinded condition until removed/left area.

name: Pip-Boy 2000
description: Basic model Pip-Boy. Maps, Holotapes, Radio.

name: Pip-Boy 2000 Mark VI
description: Model with biosensors.

props.effect: Know cardinal direction of creatures within 60 ft (unless covered in lead/steel). Functions as Geiger Counter, Flashlight, Radio.

name: Pip-Boy 3000
description: Improved model.

name: Pip-Boy 3000 MK IV
description: Advanced model with biosensors.

props.effect: Know cardinal direction of creatures within 60 ft. Functions as Geiger Counter, Flashlight, Radio.

name: Psychic Nullifier
description: Headwear to dampen psychic energy.

props.effect: Immune to psychic damage/attacks. Psykers wearing it suffer no Exhaustion penalties but cannot use powers.

name: Stealth Boy
description: Personal stealth device.

props.effect: Invisible for 1 minute (10 rounds). Single use.

name: Two-Way Radio
description: Long range communication device.

props.effect: Transmits sound within 5 ft to other radio (5 ft output range).

name: Vault Suit
description: Blue and gold jumpsuit with biosensors.

props.special: Biometric sensors allow Pip-Boy to monitor vitals (extra healing) if Decay < 5.

name: Y-17 Trauma Override Harness
description: Auto-pilot suit for injured wearers.

props.effect: Suit takes control. Wearer Restrained. Suit moves to home point or fights hostiles.
props.notes: Cannot be worn with other armor. Cannot be modified.

props.effect: Gain Night Vision for 3 hours.
Cure certain diseases. Advantage on Disease checks for 3 hours.
Cure one addiction.
props.sideEffect: Gain 1 level of Dehydration, Hunger, and Exhaustion.

name: First Aid Kit
description: Small portable box of medical supplies.

props.effect: Heal HP (0.5 * Healing Rate) at start of turn 3 rounds.
props.restriction: Does not work on Ghouls, Robots, or Gen-2 Synths.

props.effect: Remove 2 levels of Radiation.
Remove 1 level of Radiation.
Radiation DC -2 for 3 hours. Stacks 3 times.
Heal HP equal to Healing Rate. (Ghouls heal half).
Heal HP equal to half Healing Rate. (Ghouls heal quarter).
Heal HP equal to double Healing Rate. (Ghouls heal normal rate).
Automatically consumed when HP <= 50% Max HP. Applies Stimpak effect.
Automatically consumed when HP <= 50% Max HP. Applies Super Stimpak effect.

name: Robot Repair Kit 1.0
description: A set of specialized tools designed to repair minor damage to robots.

props.effect: Heal HP equal to half Healing Rate.
props.restriction: Can only be used by robots.

name: Robot Repair Kit 2.0
description: A set of specialized tools designed to repair significant damage to robots.

props.effect: Heal HP equal to Healing Rate.
props.restriction: Can only be used by robots.

name: Emergency Robot Repair Kit
description: A set of specialized tools designed to repair severe damage to robots.

props.effect: Heal HP equal to double Healing Rate.
props.restriction: Can only be used by robots.

name: Vial
description: A vial of unknown chemicals that reacts with the physiology of ghouls in a unique way, lessening the cognitive effects of feralization.

props.effect: Ghouls remove 1 Feral Level. Non-Ghouls gain no effects.

name: Alien Biogel
description: A mysterious blue gel created by aliens that interacts with human physiology in an interesting and unique way.

props.effect: Heal HP equal to half Healing Rate. Additionally, roll 1d12 on the Chem Properties table to apply a random chem effect for 1 hour (reroll allowed based on Luck mod).

name: Bufftats
description: Buffout tablets chemically mixed with Mentats to produce the effects of both.

name: Coyote Tobacco Chew
description: A leaf harvested from a coyote tobacco plant, when chewed it causes invigoration and aids in focus.

name: Daddy-O
description: An injected chemical popular amongst beatniks and intellectuals that heightens cognitive faculties, along with a hyperfocus that makes interactions awkward.

name: Day Tripper
description: A mild hallucinogenic chem delivered via pills, popular for providing an escape from reality.

name: Fury
description: A derivative of Psycho, except with extremely heightened effects. Known for inducing a sense of invulnerability and intense, furious anger.

name: Hydra
description: A soda bottle with multiple chemical vials feeding into it used to dull the pain of severe injuries.

name: Jet
description: A highly addictive chem delivered via a red inhaler, stimulating the central nervous system and triggering a rush of energy.

name: Jet Fuel
description: A derivative of Jet, infused with actual flamer fuel to produce a stronger high.

name: Rocket
description: A heightened derivative of Jet, combining the invigorating effects of Jet and Nuka Cola to produce an immense burst of energy.

name: Steady
description: A powerful chem delivered via a makeshift inhaler made with a bottle and a hose, often used by snipers to steady their aim.

name: Slasher
description: A derivative of Psycho mixed with Med-X to produce the effects of both.

name: Turbo
description: A hairspray canister with a Jet inhaler strapped to it, creating a cocktail of chemicals inside that induces a sense of slow motion.

name: Ultrajet
description: An experimental derivative of Jet designed to allow ghouls to experience the effects, accomplished by doubling the effects for everyone else.

name: Med-X
description: A brand of morphine delivered via syringe to provide pain relief.

name: Mentats
description: Strong nootropics ingested via chalky tablets that increase cognitive processes and memory recall.

name: Berry Mentats
description: A flavor of Mentats designed to intensify the cognitive increase, at the cost of social awkwardness.

name: Grape Mentats
description: A flavor of Mentats designed to increase one's confidence in social situations.

name: Orange Mentats
description: A flavor of Mentats designed to amplify one's ability to focus on specific tasks.

name: Overdrive
description: A derivative of Psycho mixed with Nuka Cola to provide a burst of energy.

name: Psycho
description: A chem used by the military, consisting of mysterious chemicals injected via syringe to induce rage and fearlessness in soldiers.

name: Psycho Buff
description: A derivative of Psycho mixed with crushed Buffout tablets to provide the effects of both.

name: Psycho Jet
description: A derivative of Psycho mixed with Jet to provide the effects of both.

name: Voca-Stim
description: Small tablets developed to produce confidence in social situations when consumed.

name: X-Cell
description: A prototype general performance enhancement chem, delivered via inhaler, that was widespread on the pre-war black market.

name: Coolant Rerouter
description: A program that reroutes coolant from other parts of the system to the CPU to increase processing speeds.

name: Data Scrubber
description: A program that scrubs unneeded data input, allowing more important data to take priority for processing.

name: EISENHOWER PROTOCOL
description: A military-grade program that deactivates all but the basic spatial awareness processes in order to maximize combat efficiency.

name: Incoming Projectile Predictor
description: A program that analyzes incoming projectiles in real time to predict the impact site, and then reroute resources to lessen the damage.

name: Military Auto-Tank AI Upload
description: A military-grade program that redirects resources to combat and damage mitigation protocols.

name: Military Turret Operating System
description: A military-grade program that temporarily replaces the existing operating system with one designed for combat, at the cost of anything else.

name: Overclock Hardware
description: A program that increases power input to all systems for a short period of time.

name: Overclock Hardware v2.0
description: A program that redirects the power supply to critical systems.

name: Servo Override
description: A program that overrides the limits on servo hardware, allowing greater stress capacity.
